methods.description: Returns air quality data for a single point (geographic name or GPS)

parameters.name: placeId
parameters.description: Identifier of a place. To obtain the `place_id` for the location you want, please use endpoints `/find_places_prefix` (search by prefix) or `/find_places` (search by full name).

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: Latitude in format 12N, 12.3N, 12.3, or 13S, 13.2S, -13.4

parameters.name: lon
parameters.description: Longitude in format 12E, 12.3E, 12.3, or 13W, 13.2W, -13.4

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description:
Timezone to be used for the date fields. If not specified, local timezone of the forecast location will be used.
The format is according to the tzinfo database, so values like `Europe/Prague` or `UTC` can be used.
Alternatively you may use the value ``auto`` in which case the local timezone of the location is used.
The full list of valid timezone strings can be found [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones#List).

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Your unique API key. You can either specify it in this parameter, or set it in `X-API-Key` header.

methods.description: Search for places. Complete words required.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Place name or ZIP code

parameters.name: language
parameters.description:
The language of text summaries and place names (variable names are never translated). Available languages are:

   * ``en``: English
   * ``es``: Spanish
   * ``fr``: French
   * ``de``: German
   * ``pl``: Polish
   * ``pt``: Portuguese
   * ``cs``: Czech

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Your unique API key. You can either specify it in this parameter, or set it in `X-API-Key` header.

methods.description: Returns PNG weather map for given area and variable

parameters.name: tileX
parameters.description: The X coordinate of Google Maps tile

parameters.name: tileY
parameters.description: The Y coordinate of Google Maps tile

parameters.name: tileZoom
parameters.description: The zoom level of Google Maps tile

parameters.name: minLat
parameters.description: Minimal latitude in format 12N, 12.3N, 12.3, or 13S, 13.2S, -13.2

parameters.name: minLon
parameters.description: Minimal longitude in format 12E, 12.3E, 12.3, or 13W, 13.2W, -13.2

parameters.name: maxLat
parameters.description: Maximal latitude in format 12N, 12.3N, 12.3, or 13S, 13.2S, -13.2.

parameters.name: maxLon
parameters.description: Maximal longitude in format 12E, 12.3E, 12.3, or 13W, 13.2W, -13.2

parameters.name: variable
parameters.description:
Name of the variable for your map. Available values are:

* `temperature`: Temperature 2 metres above ground
* `feels_like_temperature`: Feels like temperature
* `clouds`: Percentage of sky covered by clouds
* `precipitation`: Total precipitation amount accumulated since last hour
* `wind_speed`: Wind speed 10 metres above the ground
* `wind_gust`: Wind gust speed
* `pressure`: Atmospheric pressure at mean sea level
* `humidity`: Relative humidity
* `wave_height`: Wave height
* `wave_period`: Wave period
* `sea_temperature`: Sea temperature (available only for +-24 hours)
* `air_quality`: Air quality index
* `ozone_surface`: Ozone at surface level
* `ozone_total`: Total column ozone
* `no2`: Nitrogen dioxide at surface level
* `pm2.5`: Particulate matter d < 2.5 µm (PM2.5)

parameters.name: datetime
parameters.description:
There are two ways to specify date and time for your map:

1. Datetime in `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM` format and `UTC` timezone, e.g. `2021-08-24T12:00`
2. Offset from current time in `[+-]<minutes|hours|days>` format, e.g. `+10minutes`, `-2hours` or `+1days`

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Your unique API key. You can either specify it in this parameter, or set it in `X-API-Key` header.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Your unique API key. You can either specify it in this parameter, or set it in `X-API-Key` header.

methods.description: Returns weather data for a single point (geographic name or GPS)

parameters.name: placeId
parameters.description: Identifier of a place. To obtain the `place_id` for the location you want, please use endpoints `/find_places_prefix` (search by prefix) or `/find_places` (search by full name).

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: Latitude in format 12N, 12.3N, 12.3, or 13S, 13.2S, -13.4

parameters.name: lon
parameters.description: Longitude in format 12E, 12.3E, 12.3, or 13W, 13.2W, -13.4

parameters.name: sections
parameters.description:
Sections to be included in the response. You can specify more section by separating the values with a comma. The available values are:

* ``current``: Current weather situation
* ``daily``: Forecasts for each whole day, without the daily parts
* ``daily-parts``: Forecasts for each whole day, morning, afternoon and evening
    * Important: forecast for the morning, afternoon and evening is available only for the first
      7 days in the forecast
* ``hourly``: Forecasts with hourly resolution
* ``minutely``: Precipitation forecast with 1 minute resolution
* ``alerts``: The weather alerts
* ``all``: All sections

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description:
Timezone to be used for the date fields. If not specified, local timezone of the forecast location will be used.
The format is according to the tzinfo database, so values like `Europe/Prague` or `UTC` can be used.
Alternatively you may use the value ``auto`` in which case the local timezone of the location is used.
The full list of valid timezone strings can be found [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones#List).

parameters.name: language
parameters.description:
The language of text summaries and place names (variable names are never translated). Available languages are:

   * ``en``: English
   * ``es``: Spanish
   * ``fr``: French
   * ``de``: German
   * ``pl``: Polish
   * ``pt``: Portuguese
   * ``cs``: Czech

parameters.name: units
parameters.description:
Unit system to be used. The available values are:

* `auto`: Select the system automatically, based on the forecast location.
* `metric`: Metric (SI) units (`°C`, `mm/h`, `m/s`, `cm`, `km`, `hPa`).
* `us`: Imperial units (`°F`, `in/h`, `mph`, `in`, `mi`, `Hg`).
* `uk`: Same as ``metric``, except that visibility is in `miles` and wind speeds are in `mph`.
* `ca`: Same as ``metric``, except that wind speeds are in `km/h` and pressure is in `kPa`.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Your unique API key. You can either specify it in this parameter, or set it in `X-API-Key` header.

methods.description: Returns weather data for a single location and given day in the past

parameters.name: placeId
parameters.description: Identifier of a place. To obtain the `place_id` for the location you want, please use endpoints `/find_places_prefix` (search by prefix) or `/find_places` (search by full name).

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: Latitude in format 12N, 12.3N, 12.3, or 13S, 13.2S, -13.4

parameters.name: lon
parameters.description: Longitude in format 12E, 12.3E, 12.3, or 13W, 13.2W, -13.4

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The day of the data in the past. Specify in `YYYY-MM-DD` format, e.g. `2021-08-24`.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description:
Timezone to be used for the date fields. If not specified, local timezone of the location will be used.
The format is according to the tzinfo database, so values like `Europe/Prague` or `UTC` can be used.
Alternatively you may use the value ``auto`` in which case the local timezone of the location is used.
The full list of valid timezone strings can be found [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones#List).

parameters.name: units
parameters.description:
Unit system to be used. The available values are:

* `auto`: Select the system automatically, based on the forecast location.
* `metric`: Metric (SI) units (`°C`, `mm/h`, `m/s`, `cm`, `km`, `hPa`).
* `us`: Imperial units (`°F`, `in/h`, `mph`, `in`, `mi`, `Hg`).
* `uk`: Same as ``metric``, except that visibility is in `miles` and wind speeds are in `mph`.
* `ca`: Same as ``metric``, except that wind speeds are in `km/h` and pressure is in `kPa`.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Your unique API key. You can either specify it in this parameter, or set it in `X-API-Key` header.

apiDescription:
This interactive documentation is using your API key which is filled in automatically, you can find and change this in [your dashboard](https://www.meteosource.com/client).

Using the `GET` button, open your selected endpoint and read the introduction. You will find a detailed description of available parameters. You can complete the `Parameters` section and hit `Execute` to view a full API response. You can then inspect the JSON response, copy the `curl` command to run it on your machine, or obtain a URL of the request. In this way, you can easily build request command for the data you need.
apiTitle: Interactive documentation for your Premium plan
